page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES IN DEWSBURY
page.content: 20 years ago the major industry was textile manufacturing of woollen yarns rags and industrial wipers.Some mills employed as many as 500 workers.Over the years the textile industry has been declining, due to reduced demand, foreign competition and adverse currency exchange rates.So the last 10 years has seen the industry modernise and streamline its operations using more efficient machinery and less labour. Textiles still remain the dominant industry-30% of Eastborough children's fathers find employment here-but there has been a greater diversification of industry into engineering,printing and garage services.Whilst Dewsbury's population has remained static,there has been a move away from inner-town housing,and workers are more ready to travel to nearby cities to find employment.
